issue.title: Contradictory output in com.google.fonts/check/monospace
issue.body:
## Observed behaviour

Some "monospaced" fonts are not technically monospaced, in the sense that a small number of the glyphs have double- or triple-width multiples of the basic monospaced advance width unit. It's not good practice and terminal applications hate it, but it happens. In these cases, the monospace check produces contradictory output:

```
🔥 FAIL
On monospaced fonts, the value of post.isFixedPitch must be set to a non-zero value (meaning 'fixed width monospaced'), but got 0 instead. [code: mono-bad-post-isFixedPitch]

⚠️ WARN
Font is monospaced but 249 glyphs (6.58%) have a different width. You should check the widths of: ['oneeighth', 'threeeighths', 'fiveeighths', 'seveneighths', ...
```

The fail says "This font is monospaced so you should set `isFixedPitch`". The warn says "This font is not actually monospaced". In fact, because the font is not monospaced, you should *not* set `isFixedPitch`.
 
## Expected behaviour

Do not emit a `mono-bad-post-isFixedPitch` if there are `mono-outliers`.

## Resources and exact process needed to replicate

https://notofonts.github.io/latin-greek-cyrillic/fonts/NotoSansMono/googlefonts/ttf/NotoSansMono-Regular.ttf

commits.message:
Do not emit a mono-bad-post-isFixedPitch if there are mono-outliers.

(issue #3839)
update test-cases for com.google.fonts/check/monospace

pull_request.title: Improve consistency of monospace check
pull_request.body:
## Description

Fixes #3839

Moves the `post` test to after the outliers test.

## Checklist
- [x] update `CHANGELOG.md`
- [ ] wait for the tests to pass
- [x] request a review

repo.name: fontbakery
repo.description: 🧁 A font quality assurance tool for everyone

repo.name: fontbakery
repo.description: 🧁 A font quality assurance tool for everyone

commits.message:
Fix summary statistics on HTML reporter.

(issue #3997)

Generalize the grade_reflow check

com.google.fonts/check/grade_reflow was renamed to com.google.fonts/check/varfont/duplexed_axis_reflow
And now also checks the `ROND` axis.
(issue #4200)

Skip glyph_coverage check for icon fonts

And add a new is_icon_font condition
(issues #3323 and #3327)
Fix markdown in rationale for integer_ppem_if_hinted
Add new checks for languagesystem DFLT dflt in UFO sources.
Satisfy flake8.

Downgrade PANOSE consistency checks to WARN instead of FAIL

(issue #4192)
Copy over new protobuf definitions
update CHANGELOG in preparation for new release
Updating cache of vendor IDs list from Microsoft's website
update version on docs/source/conf.py

New Check: FAIL on bad postscript names

- Added to the OpenType Profile
- com.adobe.fonts/check/postscript_name
- Implemented by Josh Hadley at https://github.com/miguelsousa/openbakery/pull/63
- Ported to FontBakery by FSanches.

Note: These validations were previously INFO-level and were
      part of com.google.fonts/check/family_naming_recommendations
      which was also updated.

(issue #4254)
update requirements.txt
update dependency gflanguages to v0.5.6
update CHANGELOG, in preparation for a new release
Update version on docs/source/conf.py

improvements to the HTML reporter

Displaying vendor-specific logos and text on its header and a few improvements to the CSS rules

These improvements were adapted from the contributions sent by Guido
Ferreyra at PR #4260.
Added Typenetwork‘s profile
Formated with Black
More linting issues fixed
update test-cases for com.google.fonts/check/monospace

issue.title: com.google.fonts/check/metadata/unreachable_subsetting verify if this check is using the latest subset definitions
issue.body:
com.google.fonts/check/metadata/unreachable_subsetting verify if this check is using the latest subset definitions.

## Observed behaviour

Hi there, I was testing a font with Font Bakery, and this check reported some glyphs not included in any glyphset. We need to review and verify if this check is comparing against the latest GF glyphsets, like Mtavruli capital letters. 

I'm also not sure also why some Hebrew glyphs are reported "not included in any glyphset definition" while "hebrew" glyphset exists. Does it mean that those are missing in this subset? Why are those missing?


My result: 
```
• U+0002 : try adding symbols                                        
           • U+0009 : try adding symbols                                        
           • U+0253 LATIN SMALL LETTER B WITH HOOK: not included in any glyphset
             definition                                                         
           • U+0254 LATIN SMALL LETTER OPEN O: not included in any glyphset     
             definition                                                         
           • U+0257 LATIN SMALL LETTER D WITH HOOK: not included in any glyphset
             definition                                                         
           • U+025B LATIN SMALL LETTER OPEN E: not included in any glyphset     
             definition

           • U+02D8 BREVE: try adding canadian-aboriginal                       
           • U+02D9 DOT ABOVE: try adding canadian-aboriginal                   
           • U+02DB OGONEK: try adding canadian-aboriginal                      
           • U+02DD DOUBLE ACUTE ACCENT: not included in any glyphset definition
           • U+0300 COMBINING GRAVE ACCENT: try adding one of: coptic, tai-le,

             tifinagh, tai-le, cherokee                                         
           • U+0302 COMBINING CIRCUMFLEX ACCENT: try adding one of: coptic,     
             math, tifinagh, cherokee                                           
           • U+0303 COMBINING TILDE: try adding one of: math, glagolitic, syriac
           • U+0304 COMBINING MACRON: try adding one of: osage, coptic,         
             tifinagh, syriac, gothic, caucasian-albanian, cherokee             
           • U+0306 COMBINING BREVE: try adding one of: tifinagh, old-permic
```

issue.title: make sure description/article display correctly

labels.name: New check proposal
labels.description: We expect new check proposals to include a detailed rationale description and a suggested check-id

labels.name: Severity 5 (Highest)
labels.description: Font problems that must be addressed urgently!

labels.name: GF's priority list
labels.description: List of high priority issues for google/fonts CI

issue.body:
## What needs to be checked?

In non-noto fonts;
if Article
- Description must not be missing
- Description must be empty
- Article must not be empty

In Noto fonts;
- Article must not be missing nor empty
- Description must not be missing nor empty

## Detailed description of the problem 

The Article directory for non-Noto project is taking over the Description file. To avoid duplicated data, the description needs to be empty (but not removed, it doesn't work if it is removed). More info there: https://googlefonts.github.io/gf-guide/description.html


## Resources and steps needed to reproduce the problem

(Provide the steps and files for reproducing the problem. We will need them for developing the proposed check and for including them in tests that validate the codebase)


## Suggested profile

Suggest which profile the check should be added to. The most common are:

- [x] Vendor-specific: Google Fonts
- [ ] Vendor-specific: Adobe Fonts
- [ ] OpenType (requirements imposed by the OpenType specification)
- [ ] Universal (broadly accepted best practices on the type design community)
- [ ] Other:

## Suggested result

Which log result level should the check have:

- [x] 🔥 **FAIL** (An issue that must be corrected for the font to function properly)
- [ ] ⚠️ **WARN** (A potential issues that may need to be addressed)

## Severity assessment

5 (the specimen page won't display correctly without this)
(Classify the problem on a scale of 1 (minor) to 5 (major). How "buggy" would the font be considered if it had the problem described?)

issue.title: [com.google.fonts/check/metadata/consistent_repo_urls] fails when consistent

labels.name: GF's priority list
labels.description: List of high priority issues for google/fonts CI

issue.body: (**NOTE:** Please include the check-id in the issue's title. Check-id example: [com.google.fonts/check/metadata/parses]) ## Observed behaviour 🔥 FAIL: METADATA.pb: Check URL on copyright string is the same as in repository_url field. ([com.google.fonts/check/metadata/consistent_repo_urls](https://font-bakery.readthedocs.io/en/stable/fontbakery/profiles/googlefonts.html#com.google.fonts/check/metadata/consistent_repo_urls)) 🔥 FAIL Repository URL is https://github.com/niteeshy/ar-one-sans But: HTML description has 'github.com/niteeshy/ar' and HTML description has 'github.com/niteeshy/ar' [code: mismatch] I guess it is checking this: `To contribute see github.com/niteeshy/ar-one-sans.` ## Expected behaviour It should pass. ## Resources and steps needed to reproduce found in: https://github.com/google/fonts/pull/6885#issuecomment-1773352426

pull_request.title: Fix check/metadata/consistent_repo_urls
pull_request.body:
Git URLs can contain dashes and also there may be multiple URLs in a single description file.
**com.google.fonts/check/metadata/consistent_repo_urls**
On the Google Fonts Profile

(issue #4316)

issue.title: Add GF check: Format DESCRIPTION files HTML

labels.name: New check proposal
labels.description: We expect new check proposals to include a detailed rationale description and a suggested check-id

milestone.title: Leftover from latest dev-cycle
milestone.description:
This is a temporary "bucket" milestone containing the issues that were originally marked as planned for the 0.9.x series (and its point releases). I believe that the way I've been using milestones has not been very effective and that we need to restructure the pipeline to new checks and bugfixes, and then relocate all these issues to their new appropriate milestones.

I am not sure yet what the new strategy will be yet, but while trying to figure it out, I decided to remove the point-release names from existing open milestones so that their name is not misleading to our users and collaborators.

issue.body:
## Observed behaviour

I just rewrote the DESCRIPTION file for Comic Neue (https://github.com/google/fonts/pull/2405/files) and I reformatted the HTML to have

- one line per structure tag
- one line per sentence
- a final blank line
- no mid-sentence line breaks

## Expected behaviour

We already have checks for DESCRIPTION files, and it would be good to have a WARN check for these 'bike shed' structure; it doesn't make a difference to rendered output, but the benefit of this approach is that it makes subsequent diffs very clean.

comment.body:
At some point I started drafting an implementation for this, and left it unfinished at an open draft-PR (#3438). I am closing that now and leaving the wip patch here in case we give it another try in the future.

[issue_2811_wip.txt](https://github.com/fonttools/fontbakery/files/13116438/issue_2811_wip.txt)

Before putting more time into this, I'd like to know whether these HTML formatting requirements are still needed.

pull_request.title: Check-polymorphism: alternative implementations for a given check-ID.
pull_request.body:
This allows one to have multiple checks for the same font problem, but operating in different file formats such as: **(1)** font binaries (ttFont objects) **(2)** GlyphsApp sources **(3)** UFO fonts, etc.

This commit includes a couple examples with checks for ttFonts and glyphs files.
(issue #3436)

**Note:** This PR is an improvement on code originally written by @simoncozens at https://github.com/simoncozens/fontbakery/tree/multiple-implementations-parking-lot (see also: https://github.com/googlefonts/fontbakery/issues/3436#issuecomment-911630988)

repo.name: fontbakery
repo.description: Tools to prepare font families for inclusion in github.com/google/fonts

repo.name: fontbakery
repo.description: 🧁 A font quality assurance tool for everyone

issue.title: Come up with a way of declaring multiple alternative implementations to a single check

milestone.title: Someday Maybe
milestone.description: Fun ideas that are not important or urgent but worth keeping in mind

issue.body:
Follow-up to PR #3432 (I don't want to derail the conversation in there, nor block a PR merge with further feature ideas)

The PR mentioned above enables one to pass other file-types to FontBakery. The immediate consequence of that is that it would be possible to perform checking for the same kinds of problems but in different stages of a font project. For instance, there could be a GlyphsApp file source-level check for something that we already check on TTF binaries. In that case, the check-id, description and rationales would be the same, only the implementations would be specific to the file-type being checked. ("polymorphism" comes to mind)

I'm wondering how could our nice decorator-based syntax be expanded to allow such thing...

comment.body:
I had a work-in-progress set of code-changes to implement this, but it was not updated in a long while at the draft PR #3477 which I am not closing and leaving the patch attached here if we decided to give it another go in the future.
[check-polymorphism.txt (this is a patch file!)](https://github.com/fonttools/fontbakery/files/13116067/check-polymorphism.txt)

**note:** the `.patch` file was renamed to `.txt` because GitHub was rejecting it, even though it lists `.patch` as one of the supposedly supported file extensions fo attachments. :-P

issue.body: (**NOTE:** Please include the check-id in the issue's title. Check-id example: [com.google.fonts/check/metadata/parses]) ## Observed behaviour 🔥 FAIL: METADATA.pb: Check URL on copyright string is the same as in repository_url field. ([com.google.fonts/check/metadata/consistent_repo_urls](https://font-bakery.readthedocs.io/en/stable/fontbakery/profiles/googlefonts.html#com.google.fonts/check/metadata/consistent_repo_urls)) 🔥 FAIL Repository URL is https://github.com/niteeshy/ar-one-sans But: HTML description has 'github.com/niteeshy/ar' and HTML description has 'github.com/niteeshy/ar' [code: mismatch] I guess it is checking this: `To contribute see github.com/niteeshy/ar-one-sans.` ## Expected behaviour It should pass. ## Resources and steps needed to reproduce found in: https://github.com/google/fonts/pull/6885#issuecomment-1773352426

commits.message:
New check: glyphsets/shape_languages

This check uses a heuristic to determine which GF glyphsets a font supports.
Then it checks the font for correct shaping behaviour for all languages in those glyphsets.
FAILs if no glyphset is found to be supported >80%.

com.google.fonts/check/glyphsets/shape_languages (experimental)
Added to the Google Fonts Profile
(issue #4147)
black
a few code-style tweaks
update CHANGELOG.md

issue.title: [googlefonts] New check: com.google.fonts/check/glyphsets/shape_languages

labels.name: New check proposal
labels.description: We expect new check proposals to include a detailed rationale description and a suggested check-id

issue.body:
As has been proposed [in #4085](https://github.com/googlefonts/fontbakery/issues/4085#issuecomment-1559814431), a new check shall be written for the Google Fonts profile that checks a font via [shaperglot](https://github.com/googlefonts/shaperglot) for whether it can shape certain languages.

At first, we will manually define a set of languages for Latin Core/Latin Extended glyphsets to be shaped. Later, more language requirements can be added following different logic.

This is a very high-level check and has the potential to make other existing and planned checks obsolete, such as:
* #3322
* #3328
* #4068
* #4085

and possibly other checks related to anchors and attachments and shaping in general, as `shaperglot` would only confirm a language as correctly shaped when no marks are left unattached after [Simon's recent changes](https://github.com/googlefonts/shaperglot/commit/4fed59f2b6b58b5edb4596f4a340b2a748e03ed5).

pull_request.title: New check: GF/shape_languages
pull_request.body:
## Description
This pull request addresses the problems described at issue #4147

Note: shaperglot is not linked as a dependency in this PR because I already did that in another yet unmerged PR. Please install shaperglot manually through pip to run this PR.

## To Do
- [ ] update `CHANGELOG.md`
- [ ] wait for all checks to pass
- [ ] request a review

commits.message:
Provide some guardrails around our conditions which may return None

(PR #4230)

Rewrite os2_metrics_match_hhea rationale in a more vendor-neutral manner

(issue #4206)

Fix check/fontv rationale

Change rationale to reflect the fact that this check emits an INFO

(issue #4067)

Set default log level to WARN

Now that profiles are big, you don't (by default) want a big long list of everything that is OK about your font; you just want to know the problems to fix. Make WARN the default and have people get a list of PASS if they ask for it.

(issue #4186)
AR added to the abbreviations exception list

New check: Caps vertical centering

If possible, the uppercase glyphs should be vertically centered in the em box.

**com.google.fonts/check/caps_vertically_centered**
Added to the Universal profile.
(issue #4139)
Remove pytest unrecognized arguments (-n 8) from pyproject.toml
new repo URL
Update README.md

Update Overview.md

Remove Dashboard section, replace mentions with mentions of the UI app

Empty notdef is now a FAIL

**com.google.fonts/check/mandatory_glyphs** on Universal profile.

The check which ensures that the `.notdef` glyph is not empty has been upgraded from a WARN to a FAIL.
(issue #4093)

Improve CJK detection conditions.

The check com.google.fonts/check/cjk_not_enough_glyphs is now only run when a font has CJK codepages or ranges declared in the `OS/2` table. Other CJK-related checks are run on fonts with a minimum of 150 CJK glyphs.

* Change not_enough_glyphs limit from 40 to 150 CJK glyphs
* Split is_cjk_font into two conditions, one which checks the metadata and one which checks the cmap
* Check the metadata in the not_enough_glyphs check
* Yi is not (technically) CJK
* Also remove Yi from CJK_UNICODE_RANGE_BITS
* Update the code-tests

(issue #3846)

Fix summary statistics on HTML reporter.

(issue #3997)

Generalize the grade_reflow check

com.google.fonts/check/grade_reflow was renamed to com.google.fonts/check/varfont/duplexed_axis_reflow
And now also checks the `ROND` axis.
(issue #4200)

Skip glyph_coverage check for icon fonts

And add a new is_icon_font condition
(issues #3323 and #3327)
Fix markdown in rationale for integer_ppem_if_hinted
Add new checks for languagesystem DFLT dflt in UFO sources.
Satisfy flake8.

Downgrade PANOSE consistency checks to WARN instead of FAIL

(issue #4192)
Copy over new protobuf definitions

issue.title: Check bounding box of arabic letter high hamza glyph?
issue.body:
**com.google.fonts/check/arabic_high_hamza** on the Universal Profile.

According to what was described at #4290, it seems that we should perform additional checking:

Should we also validate the bounding box of U+0674 (the arabic letter high hamza glyph) and compare it to U+0621 (arabic letter hamza) expecting them to have roughly (within a certain tolerance margin) the same size?

comment.body: I think so, yes. Since most fonts make it a composite of hamza above (U+0654), it is possible someone will see the failure message, change the glyph class and think that is it.

issue.title: Check bounding box of arabic letter high hamza glyph?
issue.body:
**com.google.fonts/check/arabic_high_hamza** on the Universal Profile.

According to what was described at #4290, it seems that we should perform additional checking:

Should we also validate the bounding box of U+0674 (the arabic letter high hamza glyph) and compare it to U+0621 (arabic letter hamza) expecting them to have roughly (within a certain tolerance margin) the same size?
